page.title: 01Landscape of East Huntspill
page.content: Entering the village from the west you will mostly farms,the village playing field, East Huntspill C.P. school, some private houses and the methodist chapel. From the south you will see the Crown Stores on the right council houses on the left and then the Crown Inn followed by the All Saints Church. But if you come in from the north you will see some farms,the Bason Bridge Inn the Post Office, Garage, a hardware shop and the Milk Marketing Board factory. The factory is the largest building in the village By the factory the road crosses the River Brue. The landscape all around the village is rough, grazing land for cows and sheep.It is very flat,the only hills being the bridges over the nearby M5 motorway and Exeter-Bristol railway line.
